name: FilterArr
title: Filters 1 or 2-dim array
description:

- `arr` (**variant array**) - 1 or 2-dim array
- `element` (**variant**) - element to check array's items (array's item pass filtering if it equals specified element)
- `elementPos` ? (**long**) - number of column to filter array / item's number in a row (in case of 2-dim array))

Returns **1-dim variant array** with all <u>individual items</u> passed the filtering
search_phrases:

filters 1 or 2-dim array
usage:
Sub Example()
    Dim arr(), filteredArr()

    arr = Array(1, 2, 3, 1, 1, 2)
    ' Filtering 1-dimensional array
    filteredArr = FilterArr(arr:=arr, element:=1)
    Debug.Print (Join(filteredArr, ", ")) ' 1, 1, 1

    Dim ws As Worksheet: Set ws = ThisWorkbook.Sheets(1)
    ' Column B contains numbers: 1, 3, 1
    arr = ws.Range("A1:B3")

    ' Filtering 2nd column of 2-dimensional array (range)
    filteredArr = FilterArr(arr:=arr, element:=1, elementPos:=2)
    Debug.Print (Join(filteredArr, ", ")) ' 1, 1
End Sub

filters 1 or 2 dim array using callback checker-function
usage:
Function IsValuePass(ByVal arrValue) As Boolean
    ' Callback function will check each item in array
    ' Pass numbers from 2 to 4
    IsValuePass = CBool(arrValue >= 2 And arrValue <= 4)
End Function

Sub Example()
    Dim arr(), filteredArr()

    arr = Array(1, 0, 1, 2, 4, 5, 10, 3, 1)
    ' Filtering 1-dimensional array
    filteredArr = FilterArr2(arr:=arr, fnName:="IsValuePass")
    Debug.Print (Join(filteredArr, ", ")) ' 2, 4, 3

    Dim ws As Worksheet: Set ws = ThisWorkbook.Sheets(1)
    ' Column B contains numbers: 1, 3, 1
    arr = ws.Range("A1:B3")

    ' Filtering 2nd column of 2-dimensional array (range)
    filteredArr = FilterArr2(arr:=arr, fnName:="IsValuePass", elementPos:=2)
    Debug.Print (Join(filteredArr, ", ")) ' 3
End Sub

name: Filter2DArr
title: Filters 2-dim array using multiple filtering criterias
description:
Parameters:
- `arr` (**variant array**) - 2-dim array
- `args` (**string array**) - 1-dim array contains filtering criterias, each filtering criteria is a **string** in the following format: `column_number=pattern`, see [documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/ru-ru/dotnet/visual-basic/language-reference/operators/like-operator#pattern-options). <u>Example:</u> `2=##.01.####` - 2nd column's value in every row should be a date in January

Returns **2-dim variant array** with all rows from the original 2-dim array passed all the filtering criterias
search_phrases:
фильтрация массива
отфильтровать массив
filter array
_keywords:
фильтрация массива
отфильтровать массив
filter array
filter2 d arr
filter2darr
filters 2-dim array using multiple filtering criterias
usage:
Sub Example()
    Dim ws As Worksheet: Set ws = ThisWorkbook.Sheets(1)
    ' Let column A contains names: "Ivan", "Alex", "Ivan"
    ' Let column B contains birth dates: "10.01.1992", "25.03.1991", "13.02.1994"
     Dim arr(): arr = ws.Range("A1:B3")

    ' Filtering 2-dimensional array (range)
    ' We want to get anly rows with all men with name Ivan, born in January
    ' Only first row match all criteria
    Dim filteredArr(): filteredArr = Filter2DArr(arr:=arr, args:="1=Ivan", "2=##.01.####")

    Dim count&: count = GetArrLength(filteredArr) ' @dependency: 2.bas
    Debug.Print (count) ' 1
End Sub

name: SendHttpQuery
title: Sends an HTTP query to the specified endpoint
description:
Parameters:
- `url` (**string**) - resource path
- `method` ? (**string**) - HTTP method
  - GET (default)
  - POST
- `contentType` ? (**string**) - type of requested content, see [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Type) for details
- `reqBody` ? (**string**) - request body (only for POST requests)

Returns a **string** or **collection of dictionaries** (in case of `application/json` set as a `contentType`)
search_phrases:
отправить http запрос к API

_keywords:
отправить http запрос к API
отправить веб запрос к API
send http query to API
get post http query
send http query
sendhttpquery
sends an http query to the specified endpoint
usage:
Sub Example()
    ' Send GET HTTP request
    Dim res As Object: Set res = SendHttpQuery( _
        url:="https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/todos", _
        method:="GET", _
        contentType:="application/json" _
    )

    If res Is Nothing Or res.Count = 0 Then
        Debug.Print ("Empty server response")
        Exit Sub
    End If

    Dim json As Object

    Select Case TypeName(res)
        Case "Collection"
            For Each json In res
                Debug.Print ("ID: " & json("id") & ", Title: " & json("title") & ", Done: " & json("completed"))
            Next json
        Case "Dictionary"
            Set json = res
            Debug.Print ("ID: " & json("id") & ", Title: " & json("title") & ", Done: " & json("completed"))
        Case Else
            Debug.Print(res)
     End Select
End Sub

name: InsertData2XmlTemplate
title: Fills in the template with data
description:
Returns a template text (eg. XML) filled with data.

In the template text, you need to put `%stubs%` in place where you want to insert data.

The data to be filled in the template must be collected in a dictionary.

Values from the dictionary are converts to a string and inserted into the template instead of `%stubs%`.

The stub has the format `%key%`, where `key` is the name of the key in the dictionary.

The root dictionary with data could contains:

- **string values**

  The stubs `%key%` will be replaced with the corresponding values from the root dictionary.

  ```
  <Node attr1="%key1%" attr2="%key2%" >%key3%</Node>
  ```

  `key1`, `key2`, `key3` - root dictionary key, contains a string values

- **array of dictionaries** with string values

  Use this if you need to insert several identical blocks, but with different data inside.

  Use *LOOP* block with stubs to indicate the beginning and end of the loop.

  The node inside the *LOOP* block will be repated with the data of each array element (dictionary).

  ```
  <!-- LOOP EACH %key0% -->
  <Node attr1="%key1%" attr2="%key2%" >%key3%</Node>
  <!-- STOP LOOP %key0% -->
  ```
  
  `key0` - root dictionary key, must contains an array of dictionaries with string values

  `key1`, `key2`, `key3` - key of nested dictionary (each elemet of array), contains a string values

- **dictionary** with string values

  Use this if you need to insert any block depending on condition.

  Use *IF* with stubs to indicate the beginning and end of the condition.

  The node inside the *IF* block will be added to the result if root dictionary has the key `key0`.

  ```
  <!-- IF HAS %key0% -->
  <Node attr1="%key1%" attr2="%key2%" >%key3%</Node>
  <!-- END IF %key0% -->
  ``` 

  `key0` - root dictionary key, must contains a dictionary with string values

  `key1`, `key2`, `key3` - key of nested dictionary, contains a string values
search_phrases:
заполнить XML шаблон данными
заполнение XML шаблона данными
вставка данных вместо заглушек
вставить данные вместо заглушек
вставка данных в шаблон
вставить данные в шаблон
paste data to XML template
insert data into XML template
create XML
_keywords:
заполнить XML шаблон данными
заполнение XML шаблона данными
вставка данных вместо заглушек
вставить данные вместо заглушек
вставка данных в шаблон
вставить данные в шаблон
paste data to XML template
insert data into XML template

insert data2 xml template
insertdata2xmltemplate
fills in the template with data
usage:
Const QUOTE_CHR$ = """

' xml-template.txt

' <?xml version="1.0" encoding="windows-1251"?>
' <File>
'     <Document DocId="%id%" DocDate="%date%">
'         <!-- IF HAS %orderObj% -->
'         <Order Num="%number%">
'             <!-- LOOP EACH %itemsArr% -->
'             <OrderPosition Product="%item%"/>
'             <!-- STOP LOOP %itemsArr% -->
'         </Order>
'         <!-- END IF %orderObj% -->
'     </Document>
' </File>

Function GetMap() As Object
    ' Returns map with data to fill in the XML template

    Dim map As Object, obj1 As Object, obj2 As Object
    Dim arr() As Object, i&
    
    Set map = New Scripting.Dictionary

    map("id") = "1152026"
    map("date") = "30.03.2021"
    
    Set obj1 = New Scripting.Dictionary
    obj1("number") = "O-456123"
    
    For i = 1 To 3
        Set obj2 = New Scripting.Dictionary
        
        obj2("item") = "Product " & i
        
        If i = 1 Then
            ReDim arr(0)
        Else
            ReDim Preserve arr(UBound(arr) + 1)
        End If
        
        Set arr(UBound(arr)) = obj2
    Next i
    
    obj1("itemsArr") = arr
    Set map("orderObj") = obj1

    Set GetMap = map
End Function

Sub Example()
    Dim sep$: sep = Application.PathSeparator
    Dim templatePath$: templatePath = ThisWorkbook.Path
    Dim saveToPath$: saveToPath = ThisWorkbook.Path
    
    ' Get XML template
    Dim template$: template = ReadTxtFile(templatePath & sep & "xml-template.txt") ' @dependency: 26.bas
    ' Get %stubs% array from the template
    Dim stubsArr(): stubsArr = GetStubsArr(template)
    ' Get data
    Dim dataMap As Object: Set dataMap = GetMap()
    ' Insert data into template
    Dim result$: result = InsertData2XmlTemplate(template, stubsArr, dataMap)
    ' Remove technical and empty lines
    result = CleanResult(result)
    ' Save result to the XML file
    Call SaveToTxtFile(result, saveToPath, "result.xml", "windows-1251") ' @dependency: 28.bas
    
    MsgBox "XML file has been created:" & vbLf & vbLf & saveToPath, vbInformation
End Sub

name: ClassArray
title: Stack / queue / list implementation
description:
Class instance properties:
- `Values` (**variant array**) - array's elements

Class instance methods:
- `Reset` - removes all elements from the array
- `GetLenght` - returns the number of elements in array
- `Push` - adds element to the end
- `Pop` - removes and returns tail element
- `Shift` - removes and returns head element, shift `←` others
- `Unshift` - adds head element, shift `→` others
- `Includes` - checks if the element is in array, returns `boolean`
- `PushFromRng` - adds elements from the range
- `PasteToRng` - paste array elements to the range
- `RemoveDuplicates` - keeps only unique elements
- `Combine` - merges 2 arrays together, returns merged `array`
- `Sort` - sort array in-place (`asc` order is default)
- `Filter` - filter array by value, returns filtered `array`
- `Filter2` - filters array using callback function, returns filtered `array`
- `IndexOf` - returns the index of element in array or `-1` if it wasn't found
- `ToString` - returns array's string representation

Data structure is based on VBA 1-dim arrays
search_phrases:
класс для работы с массивами
class array
_keywords:
класс для работы с массивами
class array
class array
classarray
stack / queue / list implementation
usage:
Function AssertElement(ByVal element As Variant) As Boolean
    ' callback function will check each item from array
    ' pass numbers which contains digit 5
    AssertElement = CBool(CStr(element) Like "*5*")
End Function

Sub Example()

    Dim ws As Worksheet: Set ws = ThisWorkbook.Sheets(1)

    Dim a As New ClassArray
    Dim b As New ClassArray
    Dim c As New ClassArray
    Dim d As New ClassArray
    
    ' Push (add element to the end)
    a.Push element:=Array(1, 2)
    a.Push element:="123"
    a.Push element:=0
    a.Push element:="123"
    
    ' Pop (remove tail element)
    Dim lastElem: lastElem = a.Pop() ' Array(1, 2)
    
    ' Shift (remove head element and shift <- others)
    Dim firstElem: firstElem = a.Shift() ' "123"
    
    ' Unshift (add head element and shift -> others)
    a.Unshift element:="3"
    Debug.Print (a.Values(0)) ' 3
    
    ' Check if the element is in array
    Debug.Print (a.Includes("12")) ' False
    Debug.Print (a.Includes("123")) ' True
    
    ' Add elements from the range
    a.PushFromRng rng:=ws.Range("A1:C1")
    
    ' Keep only unique elements
    a.RemoveDuplicates
    
    ' Reassign values
    a.Values = Array(5, 6, "55", 6)
    Debug.Print (a.GetLenght()) ' 4
    
    ' Find index of element
    Debug.Print (a.IndexOf(element:="55")) ' 2
    
    ' Merge 2 arrays together
    b.Values = a.Combine(arr:=Array(1, 0, 1))
    Debug.Print (b.GetLenght()) ' 7
    Debug.Print(b.ToString()) ' [5, 6, 55, 6, 1, 0, 1]
    
    ' Sort / Filter
    a.Sort isDesc:=True
    c.Values = a.Filter(filterValue:=6) ' [6, 6]
    Debug.Print (c.GetLenght()) ' 2
    d.Values = a.Filter2(assertFunc:="AssertElement") ' ["55", 5]
    Debug.Print (d.GetLenght()) ' 2
    
    ' Paste array elements to the range
    c.PasteToRng rng:=ws.Range("A1"), inRow:=True ' row orientation (range A1:C1 contains [6, 6])
    d.PasteToRng rng:=ws.Range("A3") ' column orientation (range A3:A4 contains ["55", 5])
    
End Sub

name: ErrorHandling
title: Way to manage errors (aka exceptions)
description:
This macros intended to handline errors aka exceptions in you VBA project.

Supports raising (throwing) your own custom errors specific to your project as well as general Excel errors.

1. Extract  the `.zip` and import the files to you VBA project:
   - `ErrorCustom` module
   - `ErrorHandler` module
   - `ErrorForm` form
2. Describe your custom errors in `ErrorCustom` module
   - `ErrorCustomCodes` enum - your custom <u>error codes</u> (whatever)
   - `ErrorCustomProblems` dictionary - your custom <u>error descriptions</u> (whats wrong)
   - `ErrorCustomSolutions` dictionary - your custom <u>error solutions</u> (what user should do)
3. Put Tech Support contact person in `SUPPORT_PERSON_EMAIL` const in `ErrorForm` form
4. Now you're ready to use custom error handling
5. Call the `RaiseErr` Sub in other project modules when you want to display custom error
6. Make sure the module where you call `RaiseErr` Sub has proper error handling (see the example of usage below)
search_phrases:
обработка ошибок
обработка исключений
error handling
raise error
raise exception
throw error
throw exception
_keywords:
обработка ошибок
обработка исключений
error handling
raise error
raise exception
throw error
throw exception
error handling
errorhandling
way to manage errors (aka exceptions)
usage:
Sub Example()
    
    On Error GoTo ErrorHandler

    ' ... Some other module code ...

    Dim value&: value = 101

    ' Check the value and raise (throw) a custom error

    Dim isValidValue As Boolean: isValidValue  = Cbool(value < 100)

    If Not isValidValue Then
        Call ErrorCustom.RaiseErr( _
            ErrorCustomCodes.InvalidValue, _
            "The value didn't pass the check" _
            & vbLf & "Workbook: " & Thisworkbook.Name _
            & vbLf & "Sheet: " & ActiveSheet.Name _
            & vbLf & "Value: " & value _
            & vbLf & "Valiation rule: " & "Must be < 100", _
            "Module|Sub|Operation: ModuleName|Example|Check the value" _
        )
    End If

    ' ... Some other module code ...

    ' General Excel errors will be caught by ErrorHandler

    value = value / 0

ExitSub:

    ' Put here any always-executed (cleanup) code
    ' This is something like Finally block

    Exit Sub

ErrorHandler:

    ErrObj.code = Err.Number
    ErrObj.problem = Err.Description
    ErrObj.source = Err.Source
        
    Select Case ErrorHandler.HandleErr(ErrObj)
        Case ERR_FORM_CMD_RETRY
            Resume
        Case ERR_FORM_CMD_DEBUG
            Stop
            Resume
        Case ERR_FORM_CMD_END
            Err.Clear
            Resume ExitSub
    End Select

End Sub

name: ClassTable
title: Makes it easier to work with tables
description:
Class instance properties:
- `TableName` (**string**) - table's name
- `Range` (**range**) - instance of Range class, whole range of the table
- `Sheet` (**worksheet**) - instance of Worksheet class on which table is placed
- `LastColumnNum` (**long**) - number of last column
- `HeadersRow` (**range**) - instance of Range class, only header row
- `Rows` (**range**) - instance of Range, body of the table (without header row)
- `RowsVisible` (**range**) - instance of Range, rows of the table those not hidden (on which a filter applied)

Class instance methods:
- `Reset` - removes the table from `Name Manager`
- `Create` - creates the table in `Name Manager`
- `GetCell` - searches table's cell in specified table's column using filter in the following format `column::value` (or exact row index), returns the first found table's cell (range)
- `SetValue` - the same as `GetCell` but sets new value in the found cell
- `ClearFilters` - resets all the filters in the table
- `SetFilters` - sets few filters specified in the following format `column1::value;column2::value;...`
- `AddRow` - adds a new empty row in the end of the table, returns the range of added row
- `AddColumn` - adds a new empty column with specified name in the end of the table, returns the range of added column
- `DeleteRows` - deletes rows matches specified criteria, returns the number of deleted rows, criteria for deletion could be: by cells's value (=|<>|>|<|>=|<=) or by cell's background color (Long or HEX)
- `GetColumn` - returns a range of specified table's column, optionally the header cell could be excluded
- `GetColumnValues` - returns an array of values from specified table's column

Data structure is based on built-in tables, see [ListObject](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/office/vba/api/excel.listobject)
search_phrases:
класс для работы таблицами
class table
list object
named table
_keywords:
класс для работы таблицами
class table
list object
named table
class table
classtable
makes it easier to work with tables
usage:
Sub Example()
    
    ' Range(A1:C4) contains a simple table:
    
    ' Name, Surname, Age
    ' John, Wick, 32
    ' Peter, X, 31
    ' Sarah, Konor, 33
    
    ' X - cell has background color #00b050

    Dim t As ClassTable
    
    ' Init table fro, the range
    Set t = New ClassTable
    t.Create sourceRng:=ThisWorkbook.Sheets("test").Range("A1:C4")
    
    ' Search a cell by condition or exact row index
    Debug.Print (t.GetCell(colName:="Name", rowFilter:="Surname::Wick").value) ' John
    Debug.Print (t.GetCell(colName:="Name", rowIndex:=2).value) ' Peter
    
    ' Change cell's value (replace X in table)
    Call t.SetValue( _
       value:="Parker", _
       setCol:="Surname", _
       rowIndex:=2 _
    )
    
    Dim rowIndex&, rowRng
    
    ' Loop over all the table's rows
    For rowIndex = 1 To t.Rows.Count

    Next rowIndex
    
    ' Loop over all the visible table's rows (not hidden = filtered)
    For Each rowRng In t.RowsVisible
    
        rowIndex = rowRng.Row - t.HeadersRow.Row
    
    Next rowRng
    
    ' Delete rows by criteria
    Debug.Print (t.DeleteRows(colName:="Age", criteria:=">=32")) ' 2 (Wick, Conor)
    Debug.Print (t.DeleteRows(colName:="Surname", criteria:="color:#00b050")) ' 1 (Parker)

End Sub
